title: CEP Identifier Scheme Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary of identifier schemes that should be used in CEP Entity.identifiers.additionalSchemes[].schemeUri. These scheme URIs provide a stable, interoperable way to attach external identifiers (Open Civic Data, Popolo, OCDS, HSDS, national registries, etc.) without changing the CEP core schema.

terms.label: Open Civic Data Division ID
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Civic Data division IDs (ocd-division/*), representing political geographies such as states, counties, districts, and other electoral or administrative areas.

terms.label: Open Civic Data Jurisdiction ID
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Civic Data jurisdiction IDs (ocd-jurisdiction/*), representing governing bodies such as legislatures, councils, and boards that exist within a division.

terms.label: Open Civic Data / Popolo Person ID
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Civic Data person IDs (ocd-person/*), typically aligned with Popolo Person objects representing elected officials, appointees, and other public figures.

terms.label: Open Civic Data / Popolo Organization ID
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Civic Data organization IDs (ocd-organization/*), typically aligned with Popolo Organization objects representing councils, committees, agencies, and other organizations.

terms.label: Open Contracting Data Standard Party Identifier
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Contracting Data Standard (OCDS) party identifiers, used to represent buyers, suppliers, procuring entities, and other parties in public contracting data.

terms.label: HSDS Organization Identifier
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for Open Referral Human Services Data Specification (HSDS) Organization IDs, representing organizations that provide, fund, or coordinate human services.

terms.label: HSDS Service Identifier
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for HSDS Service IDs, representing specific services provided to the public (for example, food assistance, housing counseling, after-school programs).

terms.label: Legal Entity Identifier Scheme
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for the Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) per ISO 17442, a 20-character global identifier for parties to financial transactions. This corresponds to the CEP Entity.identifiers.lei field when present.

terms.label: SAM Unique Entity Identifier Scheme
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for the U.S. federal SAM.gov Unique Entity Identifier (UEI), a 12-character ID assigned to entities that receive federal assistance or contracts. This corresponds to the CEP Entity.identifiers.samUei field when present.

terms.label: Structured Non-Fungible Entity Identifier Scheme
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for the Structured Non-Fungible Entity Identifier (SNFEI), defined as a SHA-256 hash of a canonical input string: legalNameNormalized|addressNormalized|countryCode|registrationDate (with empty strings for missing optional fields). SNFEI provides an open, recomputable bridging identifier for entities lacking UEI or LEI coverage.

terms.label: Canadian Business Number Scheme
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for the Canadian Business Number (BN) with program account (for example, 123456789RC0001). This corresponds to the CEP Entity.identifiers.canadianBn field when present.

terms.label: UK Companies House Scheme
terms.definition: Identifier scheme for UK Companies House company numbers, providing a bridge between CEP Entity records and the official UK corporate registry.
